diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain that migrated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), with associated symptoms of anorexia and mild constipation. Physical examination revealed a tender RLQ and a positive psoas sign. CT abdomen and pelvis showed the appendix dilated up to 10 mm with thickened walls, mucosal hyperemia, and mild periappendiceal fat stranding, confirming the diagnosis of acute appendicitis.
